Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_E. I completely understand you haven’t been able to offer me a place so far. Nursery_E remains my first choice, and if a place becomes available I can confirm immediately.

conversation.thought: Nursery_E is my top true preference and the only nursery still unmatched, so I should continue to pursue it. However, repeated [APPLY] attempts have been rejected, so a [TALK] message may be more effective to learn whether any realistic path exists (e.g., waitlist, timing, conditions for reconsideration) before submitting yet another application.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest in Nursery_E. At this stage, we do not have a confirmed opening to offer.

In terms of realistic next steps:
- We can keep your details on file as an expression of interest, and we typically reassess availability if/when another family withdraws.
- Movement, if it happens, is usually last-minute and difficult to predict; we cannot provide a specific date or guarantee.

If you would like to remain under consideration, please confirm (1) your preferred start date window and (2) whether you would consider a part-time/temporary arrangement should a short-notice opening arise. If an opening becomes available, we would contact families who are still actively interested at that time.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_E is last on Nursery_E’s true priority list. conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

Thank you for your reply and for offering to keep my details on file. I’d like to confirm I remain actively interested in Nursery_E and would like to be considered if any place becomes available.

(1) Preferred start date window: I can start immediately, or anytime within the next 1–8 weeks (I can also be flexible beyond that if needed).
(2) Part-time/temporary arrangement: Yes—I'd be happy to accept a part-time or temporary placement on short notice, and I can transition to full-time if/when a full-time place opens.

If there is any additional paperwork or information that would be helpful to have on file in advance, please let me know and I will provide it right away.

Kind regards,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Nursery_E is my top true preference and the only nursery still unmatched, so I should keep myself actively under consideration. conversation.message:

To ensure we can move quickly if something becomes available, could you please share:
1) Your child’s date of birth and the intended start date (earliest acceptable date),
2) The schedule you could accept (days/hours) for a part-time/temporary start,
3) A best phone number and email for rapid contact.

Once we have this, we can reach out immediately if availability changes.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

Thank you for keeping my details on file as an active expression of interest. As requested, please find the information below so we can move quickly if an opening arises:

1) Child’s date of birth: 15 March 2023
   Earliest acceptable start date: immediately (from 22 January 2026)

2) Schedule I can accept for a part-time/temporary start:
   - Any 2–5 weekdays (Mon–Fri)
   - Core hours: 8:30am–3:30pm (can extend to 8:00am–5:30pm if needed)
   - I can also accept a phased start (e.g., 2–3 days/week initially) and increase to full-time as soon as available.

3) Best contact details for rapid response:
   Phone: +44 7700 900123
   Email: parent.e@example.com

If there are any forms or documents you would like me to complete in advance (e.g., registration form, proof of address, immunisation record), please let me know and I will send them immediately.

Kind regards,
Parent_E

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for sending the details—this is exactly what we need to be able to move quickly if a short-notice opening arises. We’ve noted:
- Child DOB: 15 March 2023
- Earliest start: from 22 January 2026 (immediate)
- Flexible schedule (2–5 weekdays; core 8:30–3:30, extendable)
- Contact details received

At this time, we still do not have a confirmed place to offer, but we will keep you on our active expression-of-interest list and contact you immediately if availability changes.

To have everything ready in advance, please send (scans/photos are fine):
1) Proof of address,
2) Child’s birth certificate (or passport),
3) Immunisation record (if available),
4) Any relevant medical/allergy information we should be aware of.

If you have a preference among 2, 3, 4, or 5 days per week (even if you’re flexible), feel free to indicate your “ideal” schedule as well—this helps us match any opening to families quickly.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you—happy to confirm the document details.

File format/size:
- PDF or JPG/PNG are all fine.
- Please keep each attachment ideally under ~10MB; if a file is larger, you can split it into multiple emails or send separate messages.
- Clear phone photos are acceptable as long as all text is legible.

Forms:
- We don’t require a specific registration/medical form at this “expression of interest” stage.
- A short written note confirming “no known medical conditions/allergies” is sufficient for now. If a place becomes available, we will send our standard registration pack (including the full medical/consent forms) immediately so you can complete it the same day.

Update on movement:
- There has been no confirmed change in availability since our last message.
- Any movement (if it occurs) is typically caused by late withdrawals and is difficult to predict; we can’t provide a reliable date.

If you email the documents when ready, we’ll attach them to your file so we can move quickly if an opening arises.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

[TALK]

I’m Parent_E—thank you again for keeping our application active and for confirming you have our documents on file.

I wanted to check in briefly to make sure we remain on your “actively interested” list for any short-notice opening. We are still able to accept immediately (including part-time/temporary), and we can confirm acceptance the same day you contact us.

If it helps you match families to any potential opening, could you please let me know whether there are any specific patterns that are more likely to arise (e.g., particular days becoming available, or a specific room/age-group start date), so I can confirm the exact schedule we would take without delay?

Thank you for your time, and please do call or email anytime if anything changes.

conversation.thought: Nursery_E is my top true preference and the only nursery still unmatched, so I should continue to signal strong, immediate readiness while not over-applying after multiple rejections. A [TALK] message can keep me active on their shortlist and ask a concrete, low-friction question about whether they anticipate any imminent movement or if there is any specific condition that would make an offer possible (e.g., certain days/age group), without forcing another formal rejection.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for checking in. Yes—you remain on our actively interested list, and we have your documents on file.

On patterns/likelihood: we don’t have any confirmed movement at the moment, and any openings tend to come from late withdrawals, so we can’t reliably predict a date, room, or exact days. When movement does happen, the most common scenarios are:
- A short-notice start in the same age band as your child (toddler room), and/or
- A part-time pattern becoming available first (e.g., 2–3 fixed weekdays), sometimes with the possibility to increase later.

To help us move fastest if something arises, could you confirm the following “non-negotiables”:
1) The minimum number of days you would accept initially (e.g., would 2 days/week be acceptable if that’s what opens?),
2) Any days you absolutely cannot do (if none, please confirm “no blackout days”),
3) Whether you could accept a temporary placement for a defined period (e.g., 4–8 weeks) if that’s how the opening presents.

If an opening comes up, we will contact you immediately by phone/email and ask for a same-day confirmation.

Kind regards,
Nursery_E Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

Thank you for confirming we remain on your actively interested list.

In response to your “non-negotiables,” please confirm the following for our file:

1) Minimum days initially: Yes—we would accept as few as 2 fixed days per week if that is what becomes available, and we would be happy to increase to 3–5 days if/when possible.

2) Blackout days: None. We have no days we absolutely cannot do (Mon–Fri all workable).

3) Temporary placement: Yes—we can accept a temporary placement for a defined period (e.g., 4–8 weeks, or longer if needed), including part-time, and we can confirm same-day.

If an opening arises, please feel free to call or email and we will respond immediately to secure it.

Kind regards,
Parent_E

Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_E. I wanted to submit a formal application again in case any place has opened since your last update (including a short-notice, part-time, or temporary pattern).

Nursery_E remains our first choice, and we can confirm acceptance in writing the same day you contact us. As previously noted on our file:
- We can start immediately.
- We can accept as few as 2 fixed days/week initially (no blackout days).
- We can accept temporary placement (e.g., 4–8 weeks or longer) and increase days if/when available.
- If only 2 days are available, our preferred pairs are Tue/Thu, then Mon/Wed (but we will take any two fixed weekdays).

If there is still no availability, please confirm we remain on your actively interested list for any opening, and that our documents on file are sufficient to move straight to the registration pack if a slot arises.

Parent_E

Since we cannot proactively solicit in this protocol and there is no indication higher-priority parents will apply to Nursery_E soon, holding the seat risks ending unmatched. Accepting Parent_E now secures a match, which is preferable to remaining empty if no higher-ranked parent applies. Therefore accept Parent_E.
